episodes.title: #ICAM2024 - Webpanel - Cults Across Cultures
episodes.description:
Cults Across Cultures: Real Stories and Misconceptions

Join Dr. Tabitha Chapman and guests Nikki G, Rachel Reign, and Ryan Hernandez in this illuminating webinar for Cult Awareness Month. This episode explores widespread myths about cults and cultures, emphasizing that no culture is immune to the dangers of cults. Through personal stories from varied ethnic backgrounds, the discussion sheds light on the subtle recruitment strategies of cults and offers insights into the psychological, cultural, and familial factors that make individuals vulnerable to coercive control. The panel also discusses the importance of policy changes, legislation, and the need for targeted resources to protect potential victims. If you're interested in understanding the intricate dynamics of cults and how they intersect with culture, this episode captures essential viewpoints and experiences.

episodes.title: International Cult Awareness Month: Migration, Trafficking, Cults
episodes.description:
International Cult Awareness: Immigration and Cult Vulnerabilities with Dr. Rincon

Join us in the inaugural episode of the International Cult Awareness Month podcast series, where host Dr. Chapman converses with Dr. Giselle Rincon. Dr. Rincon, recommended by Lisa Kendall of the CounterCult Coalition, shares insights on the migration crisis, mainly focusing on Venezuelan immigrants' vulnerabilities to cult recruitment and coercive situations. The discussion delves into the sociopolitical landscape influencing migration, the risk factors migrants face, and the importance of community and education in protecting these individuals. In this comprehensive episode, learn about the challenges and proactive measures for safeguarding immigrants.
